etymologies: late 16th century: probably shortening of dialect maggot the pie, maggoty-pie, from Magot(Middle English pet form of the given name Marguerite) + pie

definitions: a long-tailed crow with boldly marked (or green) plumage and a raucous voice.

notes.text: Family Corvidae: five genera and several species, in particular the black-and-white Pica pica of Eurasia and North America

definitions: used in similes or comparisons to refer to a person who collects things, especially things of little use or value, or a person who chatters idly

examples.text: his father was a garrulous old man who chattered like a magpie
he would carry these documents home to appease his secretive magpie instinct
